content.description: From a sit-started, undercling located directly in the center of the boulder, climb up vertically with the left handed feature and move slight-right on to the almost invisible crimps. Using sharp, micro-crimps and friction foot-holds, top-out dead center of the boulder and scramble off the south side of it.(DO NOT CONFUSE WITH 'THE CHILDREN WILL WEEP, ' the V0 to the right: the obvious fissure.)*This route is NOT rated in the old school tradition of sandbagging this area is known for.
content.location: Look for the isolated boulder over the hill on trail to the Sven Slab. Directly before the Sven Slab approach and before the boulder hoping begins, you'll find the "Iggy Boulder" with a blue, vertical spray painted line at its base.

content.description: From the sit started undercling of Husker Pup, traverse right on the diagonal crack that raps around to the south face of the boulder. *the sit start is optional -on account of the fact that it has a (V1) move
content.location: West face of the Iggy Boulder

content.description: 15ft isolated Boulder North of the Sven Slab with spray paint on its West face.
